emcpy.doc:
EMCPy

A comprehensive python toolkit for EMC developers and collaborators.

Currently contains the following submodules:

  • emcpy.calcs : computations, such as unit conversions, wind speed/direction from u,v vectors, etc.\n
  • emcpy.io : helper routines to aid in read/write of various formats\n
  • emcpy.plots : common plotting routines for scatter, line, map plots, etc.\n
  • emcpy.stats : functions to compute various statistics\n
  • emcpy.utils : miscellaneous utility functions\n

emcpy.calcs.units.K_to_C.doc:
Convert Kelvin to Celsius

Args
  • K : (float, or array of floats) temperature in kelvin
Returns

The input temperature in degrees celsius

emcpy.calcs.units.K_to_F.doc:
Convert Kelvin to Fahrenheit

Args
  • K : (float, or array of floats) temperature in kelvin
Returns

The input temperature in degrees fahrenheit

emcpy.calcs.units.C_to_K.doc:
Convert Celsius to Kelvin

Args
  • T_C : (float, or array of floats) temperature in degrees celsius
Returns

The input temperature in kelvin

emcpy.calcs.units.C_to_F.doc:
Convert Celsius to Fahrenheit

Args
  • C : (float, or array of floats) temperature in degrees celsius
Returns

The input temperature in degrees fahrenheit

emcpy.calcs.units.F_to_C.doc:
Convert Fahrenheit to Celsius

Args
  • F : (float, or array of floats) temperature in degrees fahrenheit
Returns

The input temperature in degrees celsius

emcpy.calcs.units.mps_to_MPH.doc:
Convert meters per second to miles per hour

Args
  • mps : (float, or array of floats) speed in meters per second
Returns

The input speed in miles per hour

emcpy.calcs.units.MPH_to_mps.doc:
Convert miles per hour to meters per second

Args
  • MPH : (float, or array of floats) speed in miles per hour
Returns

The input speed in meters per second

emcpy.calcs.units.mm_to_inches.doc:
Convert millimeters to inches

Args
  • mm : (float, or array of floats) length in millimeters
Returns

The input length in inches

emcpy.calcs.units.inches_to_mm.doc:
Convert inches to millimeters

Args
  • inches : (float, or array of floats) length in inches
Returns

The input length in millimeters

emcpy.calcs.wind.uv_to_spddir.doc:
Calculates the wind speed from u and v components. Will calculate direction as well if parameter direction = True.

Takes into account the wind direction coordinates is different than the trig unit circle coordinate. If the wind direction is 360, then return zero.

Args
  • u : (array like) u (easterly) wind component
  • v : (array like) v (northerly) wind component
  • direction: (bool, optional, default=False)
Returns

An array of wind speed (and an array of wind direction if direction=True)

emcpy.calcs.wind.spddir_to_uv.doc:
Calculate the u and v wind components from wind speed and direction.

Args
  • wspd : (array like) wind speed
  • wdir : (array like) wind direction in degrees
Returns

The u,v wind vector components.

emcpy.io.netCDF.doc: netCDF.py contains utility functions for netCDF files

emcpy.io.netCDF.variable_exist.doc:
Check if a variable exists in a netCDF file

Args
  • filename : (str) netCDF filename
  • variable_name : (str) variable name to check within filename
Returns

True or False if variable is present

emcpy.io.netCDF.read_netCDF_var.doc:
Read a variable from a netCDF file

Args
  • filename : (str) netCDF filename
  • variable_name : (str) variable name to check within filename
  • oneD : (bool, optional, default=False) Is variable_name a one-dimensional variable?
  • ftime : (int, optional, default=-1) time index range to retrieve data for
  • flevel : (int, optional, default=-1) level index range to retrieve data for
Returns

An array of data for variable_name

emcpy.plots.create_map.CreateMap.doc: Creates a map axes on a figure to plot data.

emcpy.plots.create_map.CreateMap.__init_.doc:
CreateMap constructor

Args
  • fig : (matplotlib.figure) Figure object to plot on
  • domain : (object) domain from emcpy.plots.map_tools.Domain()
  • projection : (object) projection from emcpy emcpy.plots.map_tools.MapProjection()

emcpy.plots.create_map.CreateMap.add_fea.doc:
Add features onto map.

Args
  • feature_list : (array-like, default=['coastlines']) List of cartopy cfeatures that can be found here: https://scitools.org.uk/cartopy/docs/v0.14/matplotlib /feature_interface.html

*Need to get shapefiles/figure out how to get cfeatures from Cartopy

emcpy.plots.create_map.CreateMap.draw_da.doc:
Add data layer onto map.

Args
  • plot_list : (array-like) List of map plot objects from emcpy

emcpy.plots.create_map.CreateMap.add_tit.doc:
Adds title to map axes.

Args

  • loc : (str; default='center') Location of title
  • fontsize : (int; default=12) Text font size
  • fontweight : (str; default='normal') Text font weight
  • color : (str; default='k') Text font color
  • va : (str; default='baseline') Vertical alignment of text

Adds x label to map axes.

  • xlabel : (str) Text to use for x label

emcpy.plots.create_map.CreateMap.add_col.doc:
Creates new axes and adds colorbar to figure.

Args
  • label : (str; default=None) Colorbar label
  • orientation : (str; default='horizontal') colorbar orientation
  • label_fontsize : (int; default=12) Colorbar label font size
  • extend : (str; default='neither') Extends min/max side of colorbar

emcpy.plots.create_map.CreateMap.add_gri.doc:
Adds gridlines on map axes.

Args
  • linewidth : (int; default=1) Line thickness
  • color : (str; default='gray') Line color
  • alpha : (float; default=None) The alpha value, between 0 (transparent) and 1 (opaque)

Args

Adds title to plot.

Args

  • loc : (str; default='center') Location of title
  • fontsize : (int; default=12) Text font size
  • fontweight : (str; default='normal') Text font weight

Sets x limits on plot.

  • right: (int, float) the right xlim in data coorinates

emcpy.plots.create_plot.CreatePlot.set_y.doc:
Sets y limits on plot.

Args
  • bottom: (int, float) the bottom ylim in data coorinates
  • top: (int, float) the top ylim in data coorinates

emcpy.plots.create_plot.CreatePlot.set_x.doc:
Sets the xtick labels.

Note, if len of labels does not equal the number of x ticks, a Value Error will be raised.

Args
  • labels : (array like) list of str to use for x ticks
  • fontsize : (int; default=12) Text font size
  • fontweight : (str; default='normal') Text font weight
  • color : (str; default='k') Text font color
  • rotation : (int) rotation of tick labels

emcpy.plots.create_plot.CreatePlot.set_y.doc:
Sets the ytick labels.

Note, if len of labels does not equal the number of y ticks, a Value Error will be raised.

Args
  • labels : (array like) list of str to use for y ticks
  • fontsize : (int; default=12) Text font size
  • fontweight : (str; default='normal') Text font weight
  • color : (str; default='k') Text font color
  • rotation : (int) rotation of tick labels

emcpy.plots.create_plot.CreatePlot.add_c.doc:
Creates new axes and adds colorbar to figure.

Args
  • label : (str; default=None) Colorbar label
  • orientation : (str; default='horizontal') colorbar orientation
  • label_fontsize : (int; default=12) Colorbar label font size
  • extend : (str; default='neither') Extends min/max side of colorbar

Constructor for MapGridded.

Args

  • data : (array type) data to be plotted

emcpy.plots.map_plots.MapContour.__init_.doc:
Constructor for MapScatter.

Args
  • latitude : (array type) Latitude data
  • longitude : (array type) Longitude data

emcpy.plots.map_tools.Domain.__init__.doc:
Class constructor that stores extent, xticks, and yticks for the domain given.

Args
  • domain : (str; default='global') domain name to grab info
  • dd : (dict) dictionary to add custom xticks, yticks

emcpy.plots.map_tools.MapProjection.__in.doc:
Class constructor that stores projection cartopy object for the projection given.

Args
  • projection : (str; default='plcarr') projection name to grab info
  • cenlon : (int, float; default=None) central longitude
  • cenlat : (int, float; default=None) central latitude
  • globe : (default=None) if ommited, creates a globe for map

emcpy.plots.plots.Scatter.add_linear_reg.doc: Include linear regression line info as attributes.

emcpy.plots.plots.Scatter.density_scatte.doc: Include density scatter plot info as attributes.

emcpy.stats.mstats.doc:
Function that computes and displays various statistics of a variable.

A better alternative is scipy.stats.describe()

Args
  • x : (numpy array) numpy variable whose statistics are to be computed and displayed
  • verbose : (boolean, default=True) Prints statistics if True
Returns

OUT : (object) returns if verbose=False

emcpy.stats.lregress.doc:
Function that computes the linear regression between two variables and returns the regression coefficient and statistical significance for a t-value at a desired confidence interval.

Args
  • x : (array like) independent variable
  • y : (array like) dependent variable
  • ci : (float, optional, default=95) confidence interval percentage
Returns

The linear regression coefficient (float), the standard error on the linear regression coefficient (float), and the statistical signficance of the linear regression coefficient (bool).

emcpy.stats.ttest.doc:
Given two samples, perform the Student's t-test and return the errorbar. The test assumes the sample size be the same between x and y.

Args
  • x: (numpy array) control
  • y: (numpy array, optional, default=x )experiment
  • ci: (float, optional, default=95) confidence interval percentage
  • paired: (bool, optional, default=True) paired t-test
  • scale: (bool, optional, default=False) normalize with mean(x) and return as a percentage
Returns

The (normalized) difference in the sample means and the (normalized) errorbar with respect to control.

To mask out statistically significant values:

diffmask = numpy.ma.masked_where(numpy.abs(diffmean) <=errorbar,diffmean).mask

emcpy.stats.get_weights.doc:
Get weights for latitudes to do weighted mean

Args
  • lats: (array like) Latitudes
Returns

An array of weights for latitudes

emcpy.stats.get_weighted_mean.doc:
Given the weights for latitudes, compute weighted mean of data in that direction Note, data and weights must be same dimension Uses numpy.average

Args
  • data: (numpy array) input data array
  • weights: (numpy array) input weights
  • axis: (int) direction to compute weighted average
Returns

An array of data weighted mean by weights

emcpy.stats.get_linear_regression.doc:
Calculate linear regression between two sets of data. Fits a linear model with coefficients to minumize the residual sum of squares between the observed targets in the dataset, and the targets predicted by the linear approximation.

Args
  • y, x : (array like) Data to calculate linear regression
Returns

The predicted y values from calculation, the R squared value, the intercept of the line, and the slope of the line from the equation for the predicted y values.

emcpy.utils.float10Power.doc:
Args
  • value: value to get the 10^(exponent)
Returns

The input value expressed as 10^(exponent).

emcpy.utils.roundNumber.doc:
Round the number to the nearest 10th.

Args
  • value: Number to be rounded
Returns

The input value rounded to nearest 10th

Examples

0.01231 => 0.01
0.0164  => 0.02
2.3     => 2.0
2.8     => 3.0
6.2     => 10
59      => 60

emcpy.utils.pickle.doc:
Pickle data into a file

Args
  • filename: (str) filename to pickle to
  • data: (object) data to pickle
  • mode: (str, optional, default='wb') mode to pickle

emcpy.utils.unpickle.doc:
Args
  • filename: (str) filename to unpickle to
  • mode: (str, optional, default='rb') mode to unpickle
Returns

The unpickled data from filename

emcpy.utils.writeHDF.doc:
Args
  • filename: (str) HDF5 filename to write to
  • variable_name: (str) name of the variable to write to
  • data: (array like) variable data array
  • complevel: (int, optional, default=0) compression level
  • complib: (str, optional, default=None) compression library to choose from
  • fletcher32: (bool, optional, default=False) compression related option

emcpy.utils.readHDF.doc:
Args
  • filename: (string) HDF5 filename to read from
  • variable_name: (string) name of the variable to read from file
  • **kwargs: additional arguments to pandas.read_hdf()
Returns

A Pandas DataFrame of data read from filename for variable_name

emcpy.utils.EmptyDataFrame.doc:
Create an empty Multi-index DataFrame

Args
  • columns: (list of strings) name of all columns; including indices
  • names: (list of strings) name of index columns
Returns

A Multi-index Pandas DataFrame object

emcpy.utils.printcolour.doc:
Print the input text to stdout in color

Args
  • text: (str) ascii text
  • color: (str, optional, default='red') choice of color for text
